ud6.1:17.1: For this difficult verse, I generally follow Bhikkhu Bodhi’s long discussion in Connected Discourses of the Buddha, note 255 on the Mahāvagga. Sambhava means “production, creation”, and here I think it refers to the prolonging of life which the Buddha had just rejected.
ud6.1:17.2: Bhavasaṅkhāra here is equivalent to āyusaṅkhāra and jīvitasaṅkhāra.
ud6.1:17.4: Attasambhava here refers back to sambhava in the first line.
